title: bplan data recovery software v2.62
description:
BPlan Data Recovery Software v2.62

	
The Bplan data recovery support software is the fastest way to scan and recover data. Bplan can help you find lost data after you have accidentally deleted or reformatted a hard drive, USB disk, or partition. It supports Windows XP, 7, and 8.	
 
This data recovery program can quickly help you view your lost data after you have reformatted or deleted documents or data. It works on disk, external hard disk, USB flash drive, SD card, and memory card. This software lets you download an unlimited file size.



Main Function

 Undeleted : Recover deleted data on your SD card or hard drive format

 Unformat : Recover data from formatted drive,memory card,partition

 Recover partition : Recover data lost from partition your hard drive

 Full Recovery : Recover your all lost data windows hard drive (32-bit or 64-bit)


Supported Devices

 Hard Drive : PC Hard Drive, External Hard Drive

 Card : SmartPhone Card, Memory Card Camera Card, SD card

 USB Drive : All kinds of USB drives (8gb, 16gb, 32gb, 128gb, 256gb)



Supported File Formats

  Document

 Word (DOC, DOCX) Excel (XLS, XLSX) PowerPoint (PPT, PPTX)

  Photo Image :

 JPG, NEF, CR2, X3F, SR2, PNG

  Video :

 AVI, MP4, MKV, WMV, MPG, 3GP, 3G2, SWF, FLV, TOD, AVCHD, MOV, DV, RM, QT, TS, MTS

  Audio :

 MP3, WAV, WMA, OGG, AAC, MP4, M4A, FLAC, MPC, MP+, MPP, AIFF, AC3, APE, MP2, MP1, M4B, XM, IT, S3M, MOD, MTM, UMX, etc

    Compression :

 ZIP RAR, 7zip



When Need

 Deletion :

 To recover from an intentional or unintentional deletion of a file or program


 Unintentional Action :

 Accidental deletion of a file or program;

 Misplacement of CDs or Memory sticks ;Administration errors; Inability to read an unknown file format;



 Failure :

 1 Power failure, resulting in data in volatile memory not being saved to permanent memory.

 2 Hardware failure, such as a head crash in a hard disk.

 3 A software crash or freeze, resulting in data not being saved. Software bugs or poor usability, such as not confirming a file delete command.

 4 Business failure (vendor bankruptcy), where data is stored with a software vendor using Software-as-a-service and SaaS data escrow has not been provisioned.

 5 Data corruption, such as file system corruption or database corruption.

   Crime :

 Theft, hacking, sabotage, etc. To recover from a malicious act, such as a worm, virus, hacker or theft of physical media..
